Critical race theory is the concept that race & racism are embedded in our laws and institutions ‚Äî this is born out by statistics, history, and common sense.

Call it what you want. The fact is, we can‚Äôt reach our potential as a country while our laws perpetuate white supremacy.

Laws dictated by a racial hierarchy are deadly. Our country, and our world, can not be just so long as they are governed by them.
 
Critical race theory allows us to see a path toward a truly just future where economic, social, and political power are decoupled from race.

Critical race theory is important, particularly as it relates to education, because it will play an essential role in our process of healing, truth, and reconciliation with the ills that plague our country and lead to unnecessary pain and suffering for Black Americans.

Critical race theory explores how the American concept of race manifests itself in our laws now, just as it did when Black people were sold as chattel slaves.

While the laws themselves have changed, the impact of collective biases, both conscious and subconscious, remains.

I‚Äôve seen a lot of posting about critical race theory, but not a lot of explanation of what it means, why it‚Äôs important, and how we can use it to better understand ourselves, and how our country has evolved from its racist roots.
